metadata.title: CVE-2019-19922 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
kernel/sched/fair.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.9, when cpu.cfs_quota_usis used (e.g., with Kubernetes), allows attackers to cause a denial ofservice against non-cpu-bound applications by generating a workload thattriggers unwanted slice expiration, aka CID-de53fd7aedb1. (In other words,although this slice expiration would typically be seen with benignworkloads, it is possible that an attacker could calculate how many strayrequests are required to force an entire Kubernetes cluster into alow-performance state caused by slice expiration, and ensure that a DDoSattack sent that number of stray requests. An attack does not affect thestability of the kernel; it only causes mismanagement of applicationexecution.)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-69-generic - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-69-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-69-lowlatency - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-69-generic - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-69-lowlatency - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1054-aws - 4.15.0-1054.56~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1063-azure - 4.15.0-1063.68
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1054.56~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.68').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1049.52').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.32~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
